metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29533 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description: A website could have obscured the fullscreen notification by using acombination of window.open, fullscreen requests,window.name assignments, and setInterval calls.This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 112, Focus for Android < 112, Firefox ESR <102.10, Firefox for Android < 112, and Thunderbird < 102.10. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
